qas.question: How many people were involved in the Baltic Chain?
What states did the chain extend over?
What anniversary did the chain take place on?
What part of Europe was split up by the pact?

context: The Baltic Way or Baltic Chain (also Chain of Freedom Estonian: Balti kett, Latvian: Baltijas ceļš, Lithuanian: Baltijos kelias, Russian: Балтийский путь) was a peaceful political demonstration on August 23, 1989. An <a0_0>estimated 2 million<a0_0/> people joined hands to form a human chain extending <a1_0>600 kilometres<a1_0/> (370 mi) across <a2_0>Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania<a2_0/>, which had been forcibly reincorporated into the Soviet Union in 1944. The colossal demonstration marked the <a3_0>50th anniversary of the Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact<a3_0/> that divided <a4_0>Eastern<a4_0/> Europe into spheres of influence and led to the occupation of the Baltic states in 1940.
